summary: Extend the dropshipping product page to support displaying multiple products (including a second product fetched from an AliExpress URL) on the same page, with shared cart + checkout, and ensure the setup is usable in Shopify.
architectural_notes: Product data should be fetched from the AliExpress product URL at runtime (not hard-coded).
Page should include full dropshipping flow: product display + cart + checkout.
Support rendering multiple products on the same page (multi-product layout) while using a shared cart + checkout flow.
Target a Shopify-usable setup (Shopify-compatible integration/deployment constraints).

existing_features.title: Create a product page that fetches product data at runtime from the specific AliExpress product URL: https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005006574626248.html, and renders a full product detail page using the fetched data.

On the product page, display all typical product elements derived from the runtime-fetched data: title, price, discount (if present), image gallery, description, variants/options (e.g., color/size), reviews/ratings, shipping/returns info if available, and related details present in the fetched data.
Add a dropshipping-style cart flow: allow adding the currently selected product/variant with quantity to a cart, viewing/editing the cart, and persisting the cart for the current user session.
Add a simple checkout experience (no external payment processor): collect basic customer/shipping fields, show an order summary, and allow placing an order that is stored in the backend.
Create a coherent, distinct visual theme for a modern dropshipping storefront and apply it consistently across product, cart, and checkout screens (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).
Support fetching AliExpress product HTML for an arbitrary product URL (not hard-coded) so the frontend can request multiple products at runtime.
Update the product data fetching hooks/utilities to fetch and normalize product data for a given AliExpress URL, and cache results per-URL.

Render two products on the same main storefront page (the current “/” route), each as a full product detail section (images, title, price, description, etc.) with independent quantity selection and Add to Cart actions.

Ensure the cart can distinguish line items between the two displayed products even if the normalized AliExpress product id is the same, by using a stable per-product identifier derived from the source URL in the cart item’s productId (or equivalent approach).
Add an optional per-product “display price override” configuration so the second product can be shown as $160 even when runtime-fetched pricing differs or is missing.

Make the storefront usable in Shopify by providing an embeddable mode of the storefront (minimal chrome) suitable for being placed in a Shopify page via iframe, including documented embed instructions.

new_feature_requests.summary: Full dropshipping-style product page that fetches all product data (title, price, images, description, variants, reviews, etc.) from an AliExpress URL at runtime, with cart and checkout
Implement a backend proxy endpoint that performs the runtime fetch of the AliExpress product page (or underlying data endpoint) and returns a structured product payload to the frontend.
Support a second product on the same page, fetched at runtime from an AliExpress URL, and ensure it can be added to cart and purchased via the existing checkout flow
Make the implementation usable in Shopify (Shopify-compatible integration/deployment approach)

projectName: Dropshipping-style product page that fetches AliExpress product data at runtime with cart + checkout
